image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit and yellow tie speaking at a lectern

props.synopsis: The prime minister has outlined his government's strategy for responding to American tariffs, indicating further announcements in the weeks ahead.

title.children: Albanese outlines five-point plan to respond to Trump's tariffs

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Today on the campaign trail the leaders talked tough on Trump's tariff war, thousands of people enrolled to vote and the prime minister took a tumble.

title.children: Albanese takes a tumble and Dutton gets himself in a twist

image.altText: two white men in suits with grey hair shake hands as they stand behind podiums

props.synopsis: Hungary's government has decided to withdraw from the International Criminal Court shortly after Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu, sought under an ICC arrest warrant, arrived in the country for a state visit.

title.children: Hungary says it is withdrawing from ICC as Netanyahu visits

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

props.synopsis: The Defence Flight Safety Bureau (DFSB) investigation has concluded into the army Taipan helicopter crash that killed four personnel during a training exercise off the Queensland coast in 2023.

title.children: Investigation finds pilot disorientation led to fatal army Taipan crash

image.altText: Podcaster Abbie Chatfield interviews Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The AEC was asked to consider whether Abbie Chatfield, Labor and the Greens needed to authorise podcast clips they posted jointly on Instagram.

title.children: AEC rules Abbie Chatfield does not need authorisation for podcast

image.altText: Man in a suit speaking into a microphone behind a podium while holding up a chart

props.synopsis: Donald Trump brandished a chart as he announced baseline 10 per cent tariffs on imports from all countries — but what was on it?

title.children: Donald Trump's 'Reciprocal Tariffs' chart explained

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Global car makers are rapidly reorganising in the wake of United States President Donald Trump's tariffs on automotive imports to the United States — and some are weighing pulling models from Australia with a climate impost about to take effect.

title.children: Car models could be pulled from sale in Australia over tariffs, emissions scheme

image.altText: The ASX fell, but recovered the worst of its early losses.

props.synopsis: Analysts are warning of the growing risk of a global recession as Donald Trump's tariff announcement is seen as "at the destructive end" of the possible scenarios.

title.children: Trump playing 'dangerous game' as global financial markets tumble

image.altText: A man in a suit stands before a row of US flags

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his Liberation Day trade tariff bonanza will bring in a "golden age" for America but the self-confidence and psychology behind them will be tested in coming months.

title.children: Trump is the ultimate crash-through politician. Are tariffs his brick wall?

image.altText: US President Donald Trump sits behind a desk in the White House rose garden, signing an executive order.

props.synopsis: The federal government is worried sweeping tariffs could spark economic turmoil in the region and globally, and the impact this could have on Australia.

title.children: Australia got a better deal than most, but US tariffs will hurt our allies

image.altText: Coconut trees surround a beach house in the Cook Islands.

props.synopsis: The Pacific nation's prime minister wants to reassess longstanding agreements with New Zealand, but Wellington is already unimpressed with the country's dealings with China.

title.children: Cook Islands want to be 'more independent'; New Zealand isn't happy

image.altText: A discarded plastic bottle on sand in front of a grassy area and a blue horizon

props.synopsis: The new study by the CSIRO found polystyrene and cigarette butts are some of the most commonly found items in the environment.

title.children: Plastic pollution on Australian coastlines drops 39 per cent in a decade

image.altText: A man pictured from the side as he speaks into a mic

props.synopsis: Members of Benjamin Netanyahu's close circle are being investigated for allegedly accepting Qatari bribes to promote Doha's interests at the expense of Egypt.

title.children: Qatargate: What is the money-for-influence scandal gripping Israel?

image.altText: Cameron McInnes of the Cronulla Sharks runs into the defence of the Canberra Raiders during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Raiders score a "miraculous" try from beyond halfway with 90 seconds left to beat the Sharks in Canberra. Follow live.

title.children: Raiders get 'miraculous' win over Sharks with last-gasp try

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CANBERRA WINS WITH A LAST-GASP STUNNER
THE RAIDERS SCORE A STUNNER WITH 90 SECONDS LEFT!!!!
59' Cronulla hits the front after a 'soft' penalty

image.altText: Carlton and Collingwood players scrap with each other with umpires standing nearby

props.synopsis: Collingwood and Carlton kick off round four in an MCG blockbuster with plenty of the line, with Dan Houston certain to face scrutiny for a crude bump. Follow live.

title.children: Pies star facing suspension for crude hit as Blues wilt under pressure

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: WATCH: Dan Houston likely to face MRO heat for this hit

image.altText: A sea creature that is translucent orange being help by a hand towards the camera.

props.synopsis: From giant sea spiders to "sea pigs" and "sea butterflies" — analysing the rich biodiversity in Antarctica has thrilled researchers studying the impacts of climate change.

title.children: Scientists collect unique sea creatures during voyage to East Antarctica

image.altText: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs and David Mobbs smile while sitting next to each other with their heads together at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Police will allege 50-year-old Kylie Truswell-Mobbs administered a lethal dose of prescription medication to her 56-year-old partner.

title.children: Woman charged with murdering partner with MND in 'last stages of life'

image.altText: Gina Rinehart Peter Dutton composite

props.synopsis: A senior Coalition source told the ABC Ms Rinehart believed the opposition leader was not sufficiently pro-business.

title.children: Peter Dutton and Gina Rinehart fall out over Coalition gas plan, net zero

image.altText: Kim Williams appears serious, wearing a suit and glasses as he stands in front of a sombre-looking background.

props.synopsis: ABC chair Kim Williams says he has "no doubt" Liberal leader Peter Dutton would initiate a funding review of the national public broadcaster if he wins the upcoming federal election.

title.children: 'Game on': ABC chair anticipates funding review if Dutton wins election

image.altText: an aerial view of two police cars at Glenorie after the discovery what they believe to be human remains

props.synopsis: NSW Police has charged two people in relation to the alleged murder of 39-year-old John Birch, whose remains were discovered on a property in Glenorie last month.

title.children: Woman charged in connection to man's alleged murder in Sydney's north-west

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: Independent Senator David Pocock accuses the Australian National University of misleading a Senate estimates committee over how much it paid to a consulting firm.

title.children: Pocock calls for inquiry into ANU leadership over $1 million contract

image.altText: A young man wearing a baseball cap looks down at his phone

props.synopsis: One of the four people accused of murdering Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey takes the stand for the first time to give evidence at his trial in the WA Supreme Court.

title.children: Cassius Turvey's alleged killer blames fatal trolley pole blow on co-accused

image.altText: The fences around the prison project shadows.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's Department of Justice says the 31-year-old Aboriginal man was found unresponsive in his cell at Eastern Goldfields Regional Prison.

title.children: Indigenous man dies in custody at Goldfields prison

image.altText: A middle aged woman with her sleeve rolled up and a bandaid on her arm.

props.synopsis: The shingles vaccine could be an effective intervention for dementia, with a large "natural experiment" in Wales finding a substantial drop in dementia risk for those who received the vaccine.

title.children: Shingles vaccine study finds 'huge protective signal' against dementia

image.altText: Barbed wire

props.synopsis: The Asylum Seeker Resource Centre says a riot started at Melbourne Immigration Detention Centre when frustrations about healthcare boiled over.

title.children: Concerns over detainee welfare at immigration detention centre

image.altText: Val Kilmer trach

props.synopsis: Four years before his death, actor Val Kilmer shared more than 800 hours of footage from throughout his life to make a moving documentary.

title.children: What we learnt about Val Kilmer's illness from his documentary

image.altText: A close up of a face of a toy boxer with red headgear.

props.synopsis: Shincheonji calls itself a religious organisation based on the teachings of the Bible, but former members say there is a much darker side — one that consumes its members' lives, controls their movements and uses threats of divine retribution to prevent them from leaving.

title.children: From Bible study to 'brainwashed': How an international church is recruiting

image.altText: A range of button batteries in different sizes.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) alleged that City Beach offered 70 product lines containing button batteries for sale that did not comply with Australia’s mandatory button battery standards.

title.children: City Beach in court for allegedly selling non-compliant button battery products

image.altText: Chrishell smiles softly as she reclines on a pastel pink armchair while wearing a baby blue co-ord, hair down.

props.synopsis: The dating show Love Triangle is back for its third season, with reality royalty Chrishell Stause hosting the show's first reunion special. We catch up with the Selling Sunset star to find out why, how life's going with G Flip and what she's watching right now.

title.children: What Selling Sunset's Chrishell wishes you knew about reality TV

image.altText: Lismore High Year 10 student Luke Elmsley hands keys to Lauren flint in front of the tiny home

props.synopsis: A tiny home built by students at Lismore High School has gone under the hammer at auction.

title.children: Tiny home built by school students sells for $65,000

image.altText: Headshot of Lisa Mott with her younger brother

props.synopsis: WA police receive fresh information from the public off the back of a renewed search for clues on Lisa Mott's disappearance in 1980, but breakthroughs remain elusive.

title.children: Cold case detectives probing 12yo's disappearance receive 190 new tips

image.altText: A graphic of the commemorative $1 coin, titled Swift and Sure.

props.synopsis: The Mint has released a $1 coin for the centenary of the Royal Australian Corps of Signals, complete with a secret encoded message.

title.children: Can you solve the code on this new $1 coin?

image.altText: A picture of Brian Cole and his partner Brooke embracing and holding their daughter between them on a beach.

props.synopsis: Brian Cole says his mother wanted him to become a doctor or a lawyer. He became a chef instead.

title.children: How chef Brian Cole juggles late nights, stressful shifts and fatherhood
